page.title: 17Archaeological Sites Tongue
page.content: Three miles ssouth of the village lies the hamlet of Scrabster, where in the mid 1800s the tenants were evicted to make way for sheep. This was during the time of the Highland Clearances. On a rocky eminence overlooking the Kyle is Castle Varrich said to be of the 12th cent but possibly of Viking origin. At the western end of the causeway near the cemetery is a Stone Age midden, the remains of which show how many oysters were eaten by our ancestors. There are burial cists, cairns, symbol stones and cup and ring stones at various placea around the village and all of these sights are visited by many tourists to the area. An Archaeological Society has also been started and they are working to list all the sites .
